title: Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in sections 125 and 126
short_description: Whoever receives any property knowing the same to have been taken in the commission of any of the offences mentioned in sections 125 and 126, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine and to forfeiture of the property so received.
punishment: Imprisonment for 7 years, fine, and forfeiture of property.

title: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of State or war to escape
short_description: Whoever, being a public servant and having the custody of any State prisoner or prisoner of war, voluntarily allows such prisoner to escape from any place in which such prisoner is confined, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a public servant and having the custody of any State prisoner or prisoner of war, voluntarily allows such prisoner to escape from any place in which such prisoner is confined, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Public servant negligently suffering such prisoner to escape
short_description: Whoever, being a public servant and having the custody of any State prisoner or prisoner of war, negligently suffers such prisoner to escape from any place of confinement in which such prisoner is confined, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.
punishment: Simple imprisonment for 3 years and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a public servant and having the custody of any State prisoner or prisoner of war, negligently suffers such prisoner to escape from any place of confinement in which such prisoner is confined, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Aiding escape of, rescuing or harbouring such prisoner
short_description: Whoever knowingly aids or assists any State prisoner or prisoner of war in escaping from lawful custody, or rescues or attempts to rescue any such prisoner, or harbours or conceals any such prisoner who has escaped from lawful custody, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever knowingly aids or assists any State prisoner or prisoner of war in escaping from lawful custody, or rescues or attempts to rescue any such prisoner, or harbours or conceals any such prisoner who has escaped from lawful custody, or offers or attempts to offer any resistance to the recapture of such prisoner shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor or airman from his duty
short_description: Whoever abets the committing of mutiny by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India or attempts to seduce any such officer, soldier, sailor or airman from his allegiance or his duty, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in execution of his office
short_description: Whoever abets an assault by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, on any superior officer being in the execution of his office, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetment of desertion of soldier, sailor or airman
short_description: Whoever, abets the desertion of any officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

short_description: Whoever, except as hereinafter excepted, knowing or having reason to believe that an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, has deserted, harbours such officer, soldier, sailor or airman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or with both.

title: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
short_description: The master or person in charge of a merchant vessel, on board of which any deserter from the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India is concealed, shall, though ignorant of such concealment, be liable to a penalty not exceeding five hundred rupees, if he might have known of such concealment but for some neglect of his duty.

short_description: Whoever abets what he knows to be an act of insubordination by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman, in the Army, Navy or Air Force of the Government of India, shall, if such act of insubordination be committed in consequence of that abetment, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

short_description: No person subject to the Army Act, the Army Act, 1950, the Naval Discipline Act, the Indian Navy (Discipline) Act, 1934, the Air Force Act or the Air Force Act, 1950, is subject to punishment under this Code for any of the offences defined in this Chapter.

title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman
short_description: Whoever, not being a soldier, sailor or airman in the Military, Naval or Air service of the Government of India, wears any garb or carries any token resembling any garb or token used by such a soldier, sailor or airman with the intention that it may be believed that he is such a soldier, sailor or airman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Unlawful assembly
short_description: An assembly of five or more persons is designated an "unlawful assembly", if the common object of the persons composing that assembly is to overawe by criminal force the Government, or to resist the execution of any law, or to commit any mischief or criminal trespass, or other offence.

title: Being member of unlawful assembly
short_description: Whoever, being aware of facts which render any assembly an unlawful assembly, intentionally joins that assembly, or continues in it, is said to be a member of an unlawful assembly.
punishment: Punishable under Section 143

title: Punishment
short_description: Whoever is a member of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever is a member of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
short_description: Whoever, being armed with any deadly weapon, or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, is a member of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being armed with any deadly weapon, or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, is a member of an unlawful assembly, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly, knowing it has been commanded to disperse
short_description: Whoever joins or continues in an unlawful assembly, knowing that such unlawful assembly has been commanded in the manner prescribed by law to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever joins or continues in an unlawful assembly, knowing that such unlawful assembly has been commanded in the manner prescribed by law to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Rioting
short_description: Whenever force or violence is used by an unlawful assembly, or by any member thereof, in prosecution of the common object of such assembly, every member of such assembly is guilty of the offence of rioting.
punishment: Punishable under Section 147
full_legal_text: Whenever force or violence is used by an unlawful assembly, or by any member thereof, in prosecution of the common object of such assembly, every member of such assembly is guilty of the offence of rioting.

title: Punishment for rioting
short_description: Whoever is guilty of rioting, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever is guilty of rioting, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Rioting, armed with deadly weapon
short_description: Whoever is guilty of rioting, being armed with a deadly weapon or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever is guilty of rioting, being armed with a deadly weapon or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
short_description: If an offence is committed by any member of an unlawful assembly in prosecution of the common object of that assembly, or such as the members of that assembly knew to be likely to be committed in prosecution of that object, every person who, at the time of the committing of that offence, is a member of the same assembly, is guilty of that offence.

title: Hiring, or conniving at hiring, of persons to join unlawful assembly
short_description: Whoever hires or engages, or employs, or promotes, or connives at the hiring, engagement or employment of any person to join or become a member of any unlawful assembly, shall be punishable as a member of such unlawful assembly.
punishment: Same as for a member of such assembly
full_legal_text: Whoever hires or engages, or employs, or promotes, or connives at the hiring, engagement or employment of any person to join or become a member of any unlawful assembly, shall be punishable as a member of such unlawful assembly, and for any offence which may be committed by any such person as a member of such unlawful assembly.

title: Knowingly joining or continuing in assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse
short_description: Whoever knowingly joins or continues in any assembly of five or more persons likely to cause a disturbance of the public peace, after such assembly has been lawfully commanded to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever knowingly joins or continues in any assembly of five or more persons likely to cause a disturbance of the public peace, after such assembly has been lawfully commanded to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
short_description: Whoever assaults or threatens to assault, or obstructs or attempts to obstruct, any public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, in endeavouring to disperse an unlawful assembly, or to suppress a riot or affray, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or threatens to assault, or obstructs or attempts to obstruct, any public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, in endeavouring to disperse an unlawful assembly, or to suppress a riot or affray, or uses, or threatens, or attempts to use criminal force to such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot—if rioting be committed—if not committed
short_description: Whoever malignantly, or wantonly by doing anything which is illegal, gives provocation to any person intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause the offence of rioting to be committed, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
punishment: If rioting be committed, imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both; if not committed, 6 months, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever malignantly, or wantonly by doing anything which is illegal, gives provocation to any person intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause the offence of rioting to be committed, shall, if the offence of rioting be committed in consequence of such provocation, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both; and if the offence of rioting be not committed, with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony
short_description: Whoever by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, promotes or attempts to promote, on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, caste or community or any other ground whatsoever, disharmony or feelings of enmity, hatred or ill-will between different religious, racial, language or regional groups or castes or communities.
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever (a) by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, promotes or attempts to promote, on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, caste or community or any other ground whatsoever, disharmony or feelings of enmity, hatred or ill-will between different religious, racial, language or regional groups or castes or communities, or (b) commits any act which is prejudicial to the maintenance of harmony... and which disturbs or is likely to disturb the public tranquillity... shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Imputations, assertions prejudicial to national-integration
short_description: Whoever, by words either spoken or written or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, makes or publishes any imputation that any class of persons cannot, by reason of their being members of any religious, racial, language or regional group or caste or community, bear true faith and allegiance to the Constitution of India as by law established or uphold the sovereignty and integrity of India.
punishment: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

title: Owner or occupier of land on which an unlawful assembly is held
short_description: Whenever any unlawful assembly or riot takes place, the owner or occupier of the land upon which such unlawful assembly is held, or such riot is committed, and any person having or claiming an interest in such land, shall be punishable with fine not exceeding one thousand rupees.
punishment: Fine of 1000 rupees.
full_legal_text: Whenever any unlawful assembly or riot takes place, the owner or occupier of the land upon which such unlawful assembly is held, or such riot is committed, and any person having or claiming an interest in such land, shall be punishable with fine not exceeding one thousand rupees, if he or his agent or manager, knowing that such offence is being or has been committed, or having reason to believe it is likely to be committed, do not forthwith give notice thereof to the principal officer at the nearest police-station, and do not, in the case of his or their having reason to believe that it was about to be committed, use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent it and, in the event of its taking place, do not use all lawful means in his or their power to disperse or suppress the riot or unlawful assembly.

title: Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed
short_description: Whenever a riot is committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person who is the owner or occupier of any land respecting which such riot takes place or who claims any interest in such land, such person shall be punishable with fine, if he or his agent or manager, having reason to believe that such riot was likely to be committed or that the unlawful assembly by which such riot was committed was likely to be held, shall not use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent such assembly or riot from taking place, and for suppressing and dispersing the same.
punishment: Fine
full_legal_text: Whenever a riot is committed for the benefit or on behalf of any person who is the owner or occupier of any land respecting which such riot takes place or who claims any interest in such land, or in the subject of any dispute which gave rise to the riot, or who has accepted or derived any benefit therefrom, such person shall be punishable with fine, if he or his agent or manager, having reason to believe that such riot was likely to be committed or that the unlawful assembly by which such riot was committed was likely to be held, shall not use all lawful means in his or their power to prevent such assembly or riot from taking place, and for suppressing and dispersing the same.

title: “Candidate”, “Electoral right” defined
short_description: For the purposes of this Chapter— (a) “candidate” means a person who has been nominated as a candidate at any election; (b) “electoral right” means the right of a person to stand, or not to stand as, or to withdraw from being, a candidate or to vote or refrain from voting at an election.

title: Bribery
short_description: Whoever gives a gratification to any person with the object of inducing him or any other person to exercise any electoral right or of rewarding any person for having exercised any such right commits the offence of bribery.

title: Undue influence at elections
short_description: Whoever voluntarily interferes or attempts to interfere with the free exercise of any electoral right commits the offence of undue influence at an election.

full_legal_text: (1) Whoever voluntarily interferes or attempts to interfere with the free exercise of any electoral right commits the offence of undue influence at an election. title: Personation at elections
short_description: Whoever at an election applies for a voting paper or votes in the name of any other person, whether living or dead, or in a fictitious name, or who having voted once at such election applies at the same election for a voting paper in his own name, and whoever abets, procures or attempts to procure the voting by any person in any such way, commits the offence of personation at an election.

title: Illegal payments in connection with an election
short_description: Whoever without the general or special authority in writing of a candidate incurs or authorises expenses on account of the holding of any public meeting, or upon any advertisement, circular or publication, or in any other way whatsoever for the purpose of promoting or procuring the election of such candidate, shall be punished with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees.

full_legal_text: Whoever, in pulling down or repairing any building, knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with that building as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life from the fall of that building, or of any part thereof, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to animal
short_description: Knowingly or negligently omitting to take such order with any animal in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life, or any probable danger of grievous hurt from such animal.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to 1,000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever knowingly or negligently omits to take such order with any animal in his possession as is sufficient to guard against any probable danger to human life, or any probable danger of grievous hurt from such animal, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for
short_description: Committing a public nuisance in any case not otherwise punishable by this Code.
punishment: Fine up to 200 rupees.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits a public nuisance in any case not otherwise punishable by this Code, shall be punished with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.

title: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue
short_description: Repeating or continuing a public nuisance, having been enjoined by any public servant who has lawful authority to issue such injunction not to repeat or continue such nuisance.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever repeats or continues a public nuisance, having been enjoined by any public servant who has lawful authority to issue such injunction not to repeat or continue such nuisance, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
short_description: Selling, distributing, publicly exhibiting, or possessing obscene material like books, drawings, or figures.
punishment: On first conviction, imprisonment up to 2 years and fine up to 2,000 rupees. On subsequent conviction, imprisonment up to 5 years and fine up to 5,000 rupees.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells, lets to hire, distributes, publicly exhibits or in any manner puts into circulation, or for purposes of sale, hire, distribution, public exhibition or circulation, makes, produces or has in his possession any obscene book, pamphlet, paper, drawing, painting, representation or figure or any other obscene object whatsoever...

title: Sale, etc., of obscene objects to young person
short_description: Selling, distributing, or exhibiting any obscene object to any person under the age of twenty years.
punishment: On first conviction, imprisonment up to 3 years and fine up to 2,000 rupees. On subsequent conviction, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine up to 5,000 rupees.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells, lets to hire, distributes, exhibits or circulates to any person under the age of twenty years any such obscene object as is referred to in the last preceding section, or offers or attempts so to do, shall be punished on first conviction with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees, and, in the event of a second or subsequent conviction, with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and also with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees.

title: Obscene acts and songs
short_description: Doing any obscene act in any public place, or singing, reciting or uttering any obscene song, ballad or words, in or near any public place, to the annoyance of others.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, to the annoyance of others, (a) does any obscene act in any public place, or (b) sings, recites or utters any obscene song, ballad or words, in or near any public place, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class
short_description: Destroying, damaging, or defiling any place of worship or any object held sacred by any class of persons with the intention of insulting their religion.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever destroys, damages or defiles any place of worship, or any object held sacred by any class of persons with the intention of thereby insulting the religion of any class of persons or with the knowledge that any class of persons is likely to consider such destruction, damage or defilement as an insult to their religion, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs
short_description: Deliberately and maliciously outraging the religious feelings of any class of citizens of India by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, insults or attempts to insult the religion or the religious beliefs of that class.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, with deliberate and malicious intention of outraging the religious feelings of any class of citizens of India, by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, insults or attempts to insult the religion or the religious beliefs of that class, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Disturbing religious assembly
short_description: Voluntarily causing disturbance to any assembly lawfully engaged in the performance of religious worship, or religious ceremonies.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes disturbance to any assembly lawfully engaged in the performance of religious worship, or religious ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
short_description: Trespassing in any place of worship or sepulchre, or offering any indignity to a human corpse, or causing disturbance to persons assembled for funeral ceremonies.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, with the intention of wounding the feelings of any person, or of insulting the religion of any person, or with the knowledge that the feelings of any person are likely to be wounded, or that the religion of any person is likely to be insulted thereby, commits any trespass in any place of worship or on any place of sepulchre, or any place set apart for the performance of funeral rites or as a depository for the remains of the dead, or offers any indignity to any human corpse, or causes disturbance to any persons assembled for the performance of funeral ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Uttering, words, etc., with deliberate intent to wound the religious feelings of any person
short_description: With the deliberate intention of wounding the religious feelings of any person, uttering any word or making any sound in the hearing of that person or making any gesture in the sight of that person or placing any object in the sight of that person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, with the deliberate intention of wounding the religious feelings of any person, utters any word or makes any sound in the hearing of that person or makes any gesture in the sight of that person or places any object in the sight of that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Culpable homicide
short_description: Causing death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, or with the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death.
punishment: Punished under section 304.
full_legal_text: Whoever causes death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, or with the knowledge that he is likely by such act to cause death, commits the offence of culpable homicide.

title: Murder
short_description: Defines when culpable homicide is murder, with specific exceptions.
punishment: Punished under section 302.
full_legal_text: Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or— Secondly.—If it is done with the intention of causing such bodily injury as the offender knows to be likely to cause the death of the person to whom the harm is caused, or— Thirdly.—If it is done with the intention of causing bodily injury to any person and the bodily injury intended to be inflicted is sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death, or— Fourthly.—If the person committing the act knows that it is so imminently dangerous that it must, in all probability, cause death or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, and commits such act without any excuse for incurring the risk of causing death or such injury as aforesaid.

title: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
short_description: If a person, by doing anything which he intends or knows to be likely to cause death, commits culpable homicide by causing the death of any person, whose death he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause, the culpable homicide committed by the offender is of the description of which it would have been if he had caused the death of the person whose death he intended or knew himself to be likely to cause.
punishment: Same as for the intended offence.
full_legal_text: If a person, by doing anything which he intends or knows to be likely to cause death, commits culpable homicide by causing the death of any person, whose death he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause, the culpable homicide committed by the offender is of the description of which it would have been if he had caused the death of the person whose death he intended or knew himself to be likely to cause.

title: Punishment for murder
short_description: Prescribes the punishment for committing murder.
punishment: Death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
short_description: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder, based on the intention or knowledge of the offender.
punishment: Part I: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine. Part II: Imprisonment up to 10 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death; or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both, if the act is done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death, but without any intention to cause death, or to cause such bodily injury as is likely to cause death.

title: Causing death by negligence
short_description: Causing the death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever causes the death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dowry death
short_description: The death of a woman caused by burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances within seven years of her marriage, and it is shown that soon before her death she was subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry.
punishment: Imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than seven years but which may extend to imprisonment for life.
full_legal_text: Where the death of a woman is caused by any burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances within seven years of her marriage and it is shown that soon before her death she was subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry, such death shall be called 'dowry death', and such husband or relative shall be deemed to have caused her death.

title: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
short_description: Abetting the suicide of any person under eighteen years of age, any insane person, any delirious person, any idiot, or any person in a state of intoxication.
punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
full_legal_text: If any person under eighteen years of age, any insane person, any delirious person, any idiot, or any person in a state of intoxication, commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetment of suicide
short_description: Abetting the commission of suicide by any person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.
full_legal_text: If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Attempt to murder
short_description: Doing any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine. If hurt is caused, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine. If attempted by a life-convict, may be punished with death.
full_legal_text: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be liable either to imprisonment for life, or to such punishment as is hereinbefore mentioned.

title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
short_description: Doing any act with such intention or knowledge and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or with both. If hurt is caused, imprisonment up to 7 years, or with fine, or with both.
full_legal_text: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and, if hurt is caused to any person by such act, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Attempt to commit suicide
short_description: Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards the commission of such offence.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both. [Note: The Mental Healthcare Act, 2017 has significantly altered its application, presuming severe stress and recommending care over prosecution].
full_legal_text: Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards the commission of such offence, shall he punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year or with fine, or with both.

title: Thug
short_description: Defines a 'thug' as someone habitually associated with others for the purpose of committing robbery or child-stealing by means of or accompanied with murder.
punishment: Punished under section 311.
full_legal_text: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have been habitually associated with any other or others for the purpose of committing robbery or child-stealing by means of or accompanied with murder, is a thug.

title: Punishment
short_description: Punishment for being a thug.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever is a thug, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing miscarriage.
short_description: Voluntarily causing a woman to miscarry, not in good faith to save her life.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both. If the woman is quick with child, imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.
court_jurisdiction: Court of Session, Magistrate of the First Class
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry, shall, if such miscarriage be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and, if the woman be quick with child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing miscarriage without woman’s consent.
short_description: Causing a miscarriage without the woman's consent.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry without her consent, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage.
short_description: If an act done with intent to cause miscarriage results in the woman's death.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine. If the act was done without her consent, imprisonment for life or up to 10 years.
full_legal_text: Whoever, with intent to cause the miscarriage of a woman with child, does any act which causes the death of such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the act is done without the woman’s consent, shall be punished either with imprisonment for life, or with the punishment above mentioned.

title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth.
short_description: Doing an act with intent to prevent a child from being born alive.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever before the birth of any child does any act with the intention of thereby preventing that child from being born alive or causing it to die after birth, and does by such act prevent that child from being born alive, or causes it to die after birth, shall, if the act be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the mother, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide.
short_description: Causing the death of an unborn child by an act that would be culpable homicide if done to a living person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever does any act under such circumstances that, if he thereby caused death he would be guilty of culpable homicide, and by such act causes the death of a quick unborn child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years, by parent or person having care of it.
short_description: A parent or guardian abandoning a child under 12, exposing it to harm.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being the father or mother of a child under the age of twelve years, or having the care of such child, shall expose or leave such child in any place with the intention of wholly abandoning such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body.
short_description: Concealing a child's birth by secretly disposing of its body.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, by secretly burying or otherwise disposing of the dead body of a child, whether born or not, intentionally conceals or endeavours to conceal the birth of such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Hurt.
short_description: Causing bodily pain, disease, or infirmity to any person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever causes bodily pain, disease or infirmity to any person is said to cause ‘hurt’.

title: Grievous hurt.
short_description: Defining what constitutes grievous hurt, e.g., emasculation, permanent injury, bone fracture.
punishment: Imprisonment for life or up to 10 years and fine.
court_jurisdiction: Court of Session, Magistrate of the First Class
full_legal_text: The following kinds of hurt are designated as “grievous”: First,—Emasculation. Secondly,—Permanent privation of the sight of either eye. Thirdly,—Permanent privation of the hearing of either ear. Fourthly,—Privation of any member or joint. Fifthly,—Destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint. Sixthly,—Permanent disfiguration of the head or face. Seventhly,—Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth. Eighthly,—Any hurt which endangers life or which causes the sufferer to be in severe bodily pain.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt.
short_description: Doing an act with the intent to cause hurt.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever does any act with the intention of thereby causing hurt to any person, or with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause hurt to any person, and does thereby cause hurt to any person, is said ‘voluntarily to cause hurt’.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt.
short_description: Voluntarily causing one of the eight types of grievous hurt.
punishment: Imprisonment for life or up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt of any of the eight kinds designated in section 320, is said ‘voluntarily to cause grievous hurt’.

title: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt.
short_description: Punishment for voluntarily causing simple hurt.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, voluntarily causes hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means.
short_description: Causing hurt using a dangerous weapon, fire, or poison.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, voluntarily causes hurt by means of any instrument for shooting, stabbing or cutting, or any instrument which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, or by means of fire or any heated substance, or by means of any explosive substance, or by means of any substance which is deleterious to the human body to inhale, to swallow, or to receive into the blood, or by means of any animal, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt.
short_description: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, voluntarily causes grievous hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt using a dangerous weapon, fire, or poison.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, except in the case provided by section 335, voluntarily causes grievous hurt by means of any instrument for shooting, stabbing or cutting, or any instrument which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, or by means of fire or any heated substance, or by means of any explosive substance, or by means of any substance which is deleterious to the human body to inhale, to swallow, or to receive into the blood, or by means of any animal, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act.
short_description: Causing hurt to someone to extort property or force them to do an illegal act.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer, or from any person interested in the sufferer, any property or valuable security, or of compelling the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to do anything which is illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence.
short_description: Causing hurt by using poison, with intent to commit a crime.
punishment: Imprisonment for life or up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever administers to or causes to be taken by any person any poison or any stupefying, intoxicating or unwholesome drug, or other thing, with intent to cause hurt to such person, or with intent to commit or to facilitate the commission of an offence, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt to extort property or force someone to do an illegal act.
punishment: Imprisonment for life or up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer, or from any person interested in the sufferer, any property or valuable security, or of compelling the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to do anything which is illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment for life or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property.
short_description: Causing hurt to extort a confession or to recover property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or from any person interested in the sufferer, any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of compelling the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to furnish information which may lead to the recovery of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt to extort a confession or to recover property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or from any person interested in the sufferer any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of compelling the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to furnish information which may lead to the recovery of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty.
short_description: Causing hurt to a public servant to stop them from performing their duty.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to any person being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt to a public servant to stop them from performing their duty.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to any person being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt on grave and sudden provocation.
short_description: Causing hurt when provoked, without intending to cause harm to others.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to 500 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause hurt to any person other than the person who gave the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt when provoked.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 4 years, or fine up to 2000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause grievous hurt to any person other than the person who gave the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to four years, or with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others.
short_description: Doing any act which endangers human life or the personal safety of others.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to 250 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred and fifty rupees, or with both.

title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others.
short_description: Causing hurt by a negligent or rash act.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to 500 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever causes hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt by a negligent or rash act.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever causes grievous hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Wrongful restraint.
short_description: Wrongfully preventing someone from proceeding in a direction they have a right to.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to 500 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed, is said wrongfully to restrain that person.

title: Wrongful confinement.
short_description: Wrongfully restraining someone so as to prevent them from moving beyond a certain confined limit.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person in such a manner as to prevent that person from proceeding beyond certain circumscribing limits, is said ‘wrongfully to confine’ that person.

title: Punishment for wrongful restraint.
short_description: Punishment for wrongfully restraining a person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to 500 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for wrongful confinement.
short_description: Punishment for wrongfully confining a person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days.
short_description: Wrongfully confining a person for three or more days.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for three days, or more, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days.
short_description: Wrongfully confining a person for ten or more days.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for ten days, or more, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued.
short_description: Wrongfully confining a person after a writ for their liberation has been issued.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine, in addition to punishment for wrongful confinement.
full_legal_text: Whoever keeps any person in wrongful confinement, knowing that a writ for the liberation of that person has been duly issued, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to any term of imprisonment to which he may be liable under any other section of this Code.

title: Wrongful confinement in secret.
short_description: Wrongfully and secretly confining a person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, in addition to punishment for wrongful confinement.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person in such a manner as to indicate an intention that the confinement of such person shall not be known to any person interested in the person so confined, or to any public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to any other punishment to which he may be liable for such wrongful confinement.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort property or constrain to illegal act.
short_description: Confining a person to extort property or force them to do an illegal act.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the person confined, or from any person interested in the person confined, any property or valuable security or of compelling the person confined or any person interested in the person confined to do anything illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property.
short_description: Confining a person to extort a confession or compel them to restore property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the person confined or from any person interested in the person confined any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of compelling the person confined or any person interested in the person confined to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation.
short_description: Punishment for assault or using criminal force.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to 500 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty.
short_description: Assaulting a public servant to deter them from their duty.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty.
short_description: Using force against a woman to outrage her modesty.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 1 year, up to 5 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman, intending to outrage or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby outrage her modesty, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than one year but which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment.
short_description: Defining sexual harassment and prescribing punishment for it.
punishment: Varies based on the specific act.
full_legal_text: A man committing any of the following acts—(i) physical contact and advances involving unwelcome and explicit sexual overtures; or (ii) a demand or request for sexual favours; or (iii) showing pornography against the will of a woman; or (iv) making sexually coloured remarks, shall be guilty of the offence of sexual harassment.

title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe.
short_description: Using force against a woman to disrobe her or compel her to be naked.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 3 years, up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman or abets such act with the intention of disrobing her or compelling her to be naked, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than three years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voyeurism.
short_description: Capturing, or sharing an image of a woman engaging in a private act without her consent.
punishment: First conviction: Imprisonment for at least 1 year, up to 3 years, and fine. Second or subsequent conviction: Imprisonment for at least 3 years, up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Any person who, with knowledge that the woman is engaged in a private act, watches, or captures the image of a woman, without her consent, engaging in a private act, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than one year but which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Stalking.
short_description: Following or contacting a woman, or trying to contact her, despite a clear indication of disinterest.
punishment: First conviction: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both. Second or subsequent conviction: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or with fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Any man who follows a woman and contacts, or attempts to contact, such woman to foster personal interaction repeatedly despite a clear indication of disinterest by such woman, or watches or spies on a woman engaging in a private act, shall be guilty of the offence of stalking.

title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonor person, otherwise than on grave provocation.
short_description: Assault or criminal force to dishonor a person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to dishonor that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person.
short_description: Assault or criminal force in an attempt to steal property from a person's possession.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person.
short_description: Assault or criminal force used to wrongfully confine a person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting wrongfully to confine that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation.
short_description: Assault or criminal force on grave and sudden provocation, without intent to harm others.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to 200 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for kidnapping.
short_description: Punishment for kidnapping from India or lawful guardianship.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever kidnaps any person from India or from lawful guardianship, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder.
short_description: Kidnapping or abducting a person with the intent to murder them.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person in order that such person may be murdered or may be so disposed of as to be put in danger of being murdered, shall be punished with imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person.
short_description: Kidnapping or abducting a person with the intent of wrongful and secret confinement.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person with intent to cause that person to be secretly and wrongfully confined, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her to marriage, etc.
short_description: Kidnapping or abducting a woman to force her into marriage or illicit intercourse.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any woman with intent that she may be compelled, or knowing it to be likely that she will be compelled, to marry any person against her will, or in order that she may be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse, or knowing it to be likely that she will be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Procuration of minor girl.
short_description: Inducing a minor girl to go from a place to another for illicit intercourse.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever by any means whatsoever induces any minor girl under the age of eighteen years to go from any place with intent that she may be, or knowing that it is likely that she will be, forced or seduced to illicit intercourse with another person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Importation of girl from foreign country.
short_description: Importing a minor girl for prostitution.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever imports into India from any country outside India, any girl under the age of twenty-one years with intent that she may be, or knowing it to be likely that she will be, forced or seduced to illicit intercourse with another person, or to be kept as a prostitute, or to be otherwise disposed of for the purpose of prostitution, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
short_description: Kidnapping or abducting to subject the person to grievous hurt or slavery.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person in order that such person may be subjected, or knowing it to be likely that such person will be subjected to grievous hurt or slavery, or to the unnatural lust of any person, or knowing it to be likely that such person will be exposed to the risk of death or grievous hurt, or to be dealt with as a slave, or to be forced to commit a crime, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement, kidnapped or abducted person.
short_description: Concealing or confining a kidnapped or abducted person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, knowing that any person has been kidnapped or has been abducted, wrongfully conceals or detains such person, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had kidnapped or abducted such person.

title: Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years with intent to steal from its person.
short_description: Kidnapping a child under ten years with the intent to steal from them.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any child under the age of ten years with the intention of taking movable property from the person of such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Trafficking of person.
short_description: Trafficking a person for the purpose of exploitation.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 7 years, up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, for the purpose of exploitation, recruits, transports, harbours, transfers or receives a person or persons, by means of threat or use of force or other forms of coercion, or by abduction, or by fraud, or by deception, or by the abuse of power, or by the giving or receiving of payments or benefits to achieve the consent of a person having control over another person, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than seven years but which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Exploitation of a trafficked person.
short_description: Exploiting a trafficked person.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 3 years, up to 5 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever exploits a trafficked person, or causes such person to be exploited, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than three years but which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Habitual dealing in slaves.
short_description: Habitually dealing in slaves.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever habitually imports, exports, removes, buys, sells, traffics or deals in slaves, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Selling minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
short_description: Selling a minor for prostitution.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells, lets to hire, or otherwise disposes of any person under the age of eighteen years with intent that such person shall be, or knowing it to be likely that such person will be, employed or used for the purpose of prostitution or illicit intercourse with any person or for any unlawful and immoral purpose, or knowing it to be likely that such person will be, a prostitute, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Buying minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
short_description: Buying a minor for prostitution.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever buys, hires, or otherwise obtains possession of any person under the age of eighteen years with intent that such person shall be, or knowing it to be likely that such person will be, employed or used for the purpose of prostitution or illicit intercourse with any person or for any unlawful and immoral purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Unlawful compulsory labour.
short_description: Compelling a person to labour against their will.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever unlawfully compels any person to labour against the will of that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Rape.
short_description: Defining the offence of rape.
punishment: Varies based on the specific act.
full_legal_text: A man is said to commit 'rape' who has sexual intercourse with a woman under circumstances falling under any of the following seven descriptions... (detailed descriptions of non-consensual intercourse).

title: Punishment for rape.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of rape.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for at least 10 years, up to life, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits rape shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than ten years, but which may extend to imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Intercourse by a man with his wife during separation.
short_description: A husband having sexual intercourse with his wife during separation.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 2 years, up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever has sexual intercourse with his own wife, who is living separately from him under a decree of judicial separation or under any other order of a competent Court, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than two years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual intercourse by public servant with a woman in his custody.
short_description: A public servant having sexual intercourse with a woman in his custody.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 5 years, up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a public servant, and having sexual intercourse with any woman who is in his custody, or in the custody of any person under his control, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than five years, but which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual intercourse by superintendent of jail, remand home, etc.
short_description: Superintendent of a jail or similar institution having sexual intercourse with a female inmate.
punishment: Imprisonment for at least 5 years, up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a superintendent or manager of a jail, remand home, or any other place of confinement, has sexual intercourse with any female inmate of such jail, remand home, or place of confinement, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than five years, but which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Gang rape.
short_description: When rape is committed by one or more persons in a group.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for life, which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life, and fine.
full_legal_text: When a woman is raped by one or more persons constituting a group acting in furtherance of a common intention, each of the persons shall be deemed to have committed the offence of rape and shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than twenty years, but which may extend to rigorous imprisonment for life, which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for repeat offenders.
short_description: Punishment for repeat rape offenders.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life, or with death.
