full_legal_text: Whoever having been previously convicted of an offence punishable under section 376 or section 376A or section 376D is subsequently convicted of any of the said offences shall be punished with imprisonment for life which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life, or with death.

title: Unnatural offences.
short_description: Sexual acts against the order of nature.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily has carnal intercourse against the order of nature with any man, woman or animal, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for theft.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of theft.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Theft in dwelling-house, etc.
short_description: Theft committed in a house, tent, or vessel used as a human dwelling or for property custody.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits theft in any building, tent or vessel, which is used as a human dwelling, or used for the custody of property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master.
short_description: A clerk or servant committing theft on property in the possession of their master.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a clerk or servant, or being employed in the capacity of a clerk or servant, commits theft in respect of any property in the possession of his master or employer, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt or restraint in order to the committing of the theft.
short_description: Theft committed after preparation to cause death, hurt, or restraint.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits theft, having made preparation for causing death, or hurt, or wrongful restraint, or fear of death, or of hurt, or of wrongful restraint, to any person, in order to the committing of such theft, or in order to the effecting of his escape after the committing of such theft, or in order to the retaining of property taken by such theft, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for extortion.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of extortion.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits extortion shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Putting person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion.
short_description: Putting a person in fear of injury to commit extortion.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, in order to commit extortion, puts any person in fear, or attempts to put any person in fear, of any injury, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt.
short_description: Extortion where the threat is of death or grievous hurt.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits extortion by putting any person in fear of death or of grievous hurt to that person or to any other, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Putting person in fear of death or of grievous hurt, in order to commit extortion.
short_description: Putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt to commit extortion.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, in order to commit extortion, puts or attempts to put any person in fear of death or of grievous hurt to that person or to any other, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, etc.
short_description: Extortion by threatening to accuse someone of a crime punishable with death or life imprisonment.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits extortion by putting any person in fear of an accusation, against that person or any other, of having committed or attempted to commit any offence punishable with death, or with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Putting person in fear of accusation of offence, in order to commit extortion.
short_description: Putting a person in fear of accusation to commit extortion.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, in order to commit extortion, puts or attempts to put any person in fear of an accusation, against that person or any other, of having committed or attempted to commit an offence punishable with death, or with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for robbery.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of robbery.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine. If committed on a highway between sunset and sunrise, up to 14 years.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and, if the robbery be committed on the highway, between sunset and sunrise, the imprisonment may be extended to fourteen years.

title: Attempt to commit robbery.
short_description: Attempting to commit robbery.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever attempts to commit robbery, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery.
short_description: Causing hurt to someone during the commission of robbery.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: If any person, in committing or attempting to commit robbery, voluntarily causes hurt, such person, and any other person jointly concerned in the robbery, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for dacoity.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of dacoity.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dacoity with murder.
short_description: If murder is committed during dacoity, all those involved are liable.
punishment: Death, or imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: If any one of five or more persons, who are conjointly committing dacoity, commits murder in the commission of that dacoity, every one of those persons shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Robbery or dacoity with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt.
short_description: When a person uses a deadly weapon or causes grievous hurt during a robbery or dacoity.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for at least 7 years.
full_legal_text: If, at the time of committing robbery or dacoity, the offender uses any deadly weapon, or causes grievous hurt, or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt, the imprisonment with which such offender shall be punished shall not be less than seven years.

title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon.
short_description: Attempting robbery or dacoity while armed with a deadly weapon.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment for at least 7 years.
full_legal_text: If, at the time of attempting to commit robbery or dacoity, the offender is armed with any deadly weapon, the imprisonment with which such offender shall be punished shall not be less than seven years.

title: Making preparation to commit dacoity.
short_description: Preparing to commit a dacoity.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes any preparation for the purpose of committing dacoity, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for belonging to gang of dacoits.
short_description: Belonging to a gang of dacoits.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have belonged to a gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing dacoity, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for belonging to gang of thieves.
short_description: Belonging to a gang of thieves.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have belonged to any wandering or other gang of persons associated for the purpose of habitually committing theft or robbery, and not of dacoity, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assembling for purpose of committing dacoity.
short_description: Assembling with five or more persons with the intent to commit dacoity.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall be one of five or more persons assembled for the purpose of committing dacoity, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonest misappropriation of property.
short_description: Dishonestly taking property for one's own use.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use any movable property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death.
short_description: Dishonestly taking property that belonged to a deceased person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use property, knowing that such property was in the possession of a deceased person at the time of that person's decease, and that it has not since been in the possession of any person legally entitled to it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for criminal breach of trust.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of criminal breach of trust.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal breach of trust by carrier, etc.
short_description: A carrier, wharfinger, or warehouse-keeper committing criminal breach of trust.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being entrusted with property as a carrier, wharfinger or warehouse-keeper, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of such property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant.
short_description: A clerk or servant committing criminal breach of trust.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a clerk or servant, or being employed in the capacity of a clerk or servant, and being in any manner entrusted in such capacity with property, or with any dominion over property, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of that property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust by public servant, or by banker, merchant or agent.
short_description: A public servant, banker, merchant, or agent committing criminal breach of trust.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being in any manner entrusted with property, or with any dominion over property in his capacity of a public servant or in the way of his business as a banker, merchant, factor, broker, attorney or agent, commits criminal breach of trust in respect of that property, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonestly receiving stolen property.
short_description: Dishonestly receiving stolen property, knowing it to be stolen.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly receives or retains any stolen property, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be stolen property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity.
short_description: Dishonestly receiving property stolen during a dacoity.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly receives or retains any stolen property, the possession whereof he knows or has reason to believe to have been transferred by the commission of dacoity, or is at any time in possession of any property which he knows or has reason to believe to have been stolen in the commission of a dacoity, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Habitually dealing in stolen property.
short_description: Habitually dealing in stolen property.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever habitually receives or deals in property which he knows or has reason to believe to be stolen property, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assisting in concealment of stolen property.
short_description: Assisting in concealing or disposing of stolen property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily assists in concealing or disposing of or making away with property which he knows or has reason to believe to be stolen property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for cheating.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of cheating.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever cheats shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may ensue to person whose interest offender is bound to protect.
short_description: Cheating by a person who is bound by law or a legal contract to protect the interests of another.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever cheats with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause wrongful loss to a person whose interest in the transaction to which the cheating relates, he was bound, either by law, or by a legal contract, to protect, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for cheating by personation.
short_description: Punishment for cheating by pretending to be someone else.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever cheats by personation shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property.
short_description: Cheating and dishonestly inducing someone to deliver property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the person deceived to deliver any property to any person, or to make, alter or destroy the whole or any part of a valuable security, or anything which is signed or sealed, and which is capable of being converted into a valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors.
short_description: Dishonestly removing or concealing property to prevent creditors from seizing it.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently conceals or removes any property of himself or any other person, or dishonestly or fraudulently assists in the concealment or removal thereof, or dishonestly or fraudulently releases any claim or demand, to prevent that property or valuable security from being taken in execution of a decree or order which has been made, or is likely to be made, or for the purpose of defrauding any of his creditors, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonestly or fraudulently preventing debt being available for creditors.
short_description: Dishonestly preventing a debt from being available to creditors.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently prevents any debt or demand due to himself or to any other person from being made available for the satisfaction of his creditors or any of them, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration.
short_description: Dishonestly making a false statement of consideration in a property transfer deed.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently signs, executes, or becomes a party to any deed or instrument which purports to transfer or subject to any charge any property, or any interest therein, and which contains any false statement relating to the consideration for such transfer or charge, or any false statement as to the person who is the real owner or beneficiary, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property.
short_description: Dishonestly or fraudulently removing or concealing property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly or fraudulently conceals or removes any property of himself or any other person, or dishonestly or fraudulently assists in the concealment or removal thereof, or dishonestly or fraudulently releases any claim or demand, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for mischief.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of mischief.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees.
short_description: Mischief causing damage of 50 rupees or more.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief and thereby causes loss or damage to the amount of fifty rupees or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by killing or maiming animal of the value of ten rupees.
short_description: Mischief by killing or maiming an animal of 10 rupees or more.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless any animal or animals of the value of ten rupees or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle, etc., of any value or any animal of the value of fifty rupees.
short_description: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle or an animal of 50 rupees or more.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by killing, poisoning, maiming or rendering useless any elephant, camel, horse, mule, buffalo, bull, cow or ox, whatever may be the value thereof, or any other animal of the value of fifty rupees or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage attended with damage.
short_description: Mischief by causing flooding or obstructing public drainage, causing damage.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by doing any act which causes or is likely to cause an inundation or a public drainage attended with damage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river or channel.
short_description: Mischief by damaging a public road, bridge, etc.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by doing any act which renders or which he knows to be likely to render any public road, bridge, navigable river or navigable channel, or any line of railway, or any other public property, impassable or less safe for travelling or conveying property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage.
short_description: Mischief by causing flooding or obstructing public drainage.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by doing any act which causes or is likely to cause an inundation or a public drainage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by destroying or moving, etc., a lighthouse or sea-mark with intent to endanger navigation.
short_description: Mischief by damaging a lighthouse or sea-mark.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by destroying, moving or rendering less useful or injuring any lighthouse or sea-mark or any other public property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief by destroying or moving, etc., a landmark fixed by public authority.
short_description: Mischief by damaging a landmark set by a public authority.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by destroying or moving any landmark fixed by the authority of a public servant, or by any person acting under the authority of a public servant, or by the authority of any person lawfully entitled thereto, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage to amount of one hundred or (in case of agricultural produce) ten rupees.
short_description: Mischief by fire or explosives, causing damage of 100 rupees or more (or 10 rupees for agricultural produce).
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by fire or any explosive substance, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, damage to any property to the amount of one hundred rupees or upwards, or where the property is agricultural produce, to the amount of ten rupees or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc.
short_description: Mischief by fire or explosives to destroy a house or a place of worship.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief by fire or any explosive substance, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, the destruction of any building which is ordinarily used as a place of worship, or as a human dwelling, or as a place for the custody of property, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or vessel of twenty tons burden.
short_description: Mischief to destroy a decked vessel or a vessel of 20 tons burden.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief with the intention of destroying or making unsafe a decked vessel, or a vessel of the burden of twenty tons or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for mischief by fire or explosive substance on vessel.
short_description: Punishment for mischief by fire or explosives on a vessel.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits, or attempts to commit, mischief by fire or any explosive substance, intending to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, the destruction of any decked vessel or a vessel of the burden of twenty tons or upwards, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Casting away or destroying vessel with intent to cause wrongful loss to owner or underwriter.
short_description: Casting away or destroying a vessel with intent to cause wrongful loss.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever casts away or destroys any vessel with intent to cause wrongful loss to the owner or any person interested in the vessel or to the insurer, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief committed after preparation for causing death or hurt or wrongful restraint.
short_description: Mischief committed after preparing to cause death, hurt, or wrongful restraint.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits mischief, having made preparation for causing to any person death, or hurt, or wrongful restraint, or fear of death, or of hurt, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for criminal trespass.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of criminal trespass.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to 500 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits criminal trespass shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for house-trespass.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of house-trespass.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to 1000 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits house-trespass shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with death.
short_description: House-trespass with the intent to commit a crime punishable with death.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to the committing of any offence punishable with death, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment for life.
short_description: House-trespass with the intent to commit a crime punishable with life imprisonment.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to the committing of any offence punishable with imprisonment for life, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment.
short_description: House-trespass with the intent to commit a crime punishable with imprisonment.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine. If the offence is theft, imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
court_jurisdiction: Any Magistrate, Magistrate of the First Class
full_legal_text: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to the committing of any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the offence intended to be committed is theft, the term of the imprisonment may be extended to seven years.

title: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint.
short_description: House-trespass after preparing to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits house-trespass, having made preparation for causing hurt to any person, or for assaulting any person, or for wrongfully restraining any person, or for putting any person in fear of hurt, or of assault, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking.
short_description: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment.
short_description: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking with intent to commit a crime punishable with imprisonment.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine. If the offence is theft, up to 10 years.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, in order to the committing of any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if the offence intended to be committed is theft, the term of the imprisonment may be extended to ten years.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint.
short_description: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparing to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, having made preparation for causing hurt to any person, or for assaulting any person, or for wrongfully restraining any person, or for putting any person in fear of hurt, or of assault, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night.
short_description: Punishment for lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night, or house-breaking by night, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night in order to commit offence punishable with imprisonment.
short_description: Lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night with intent to commit a crime punishable with imprisonment.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, and fine. If the offence is theft, up to 14 years.
court_jurisdiction: Magistrate of the First Class, Court of Session
full_legal_text: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night, or house-breaking by night, in order to the committing of any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine; and, if the offence intended to be committed is theft, the term of the imprisonment may be extended to fourteen years.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint.
short_description: Lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night after preparing to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 14 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night, or house-breaking by night, having made preparation for causing to any person death, or hurt, or wrongful restraint, or for putting any person in fear of death, or of hurt, or of wrongful restraint, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to fourteen years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Grievous hurt caused while committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking.
short_description: Causing grievous hurt while committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, in the course of committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, causes grievous hurt to any person, or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: All persons jointly concerned in lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night punishable for grievous hurt caused by one of them.
short_description: If one person causes grievous hurt during a joint night-time house-trespass, all are liable.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: If, at the time of the committing of lurking house-trespass by night, or house-breaking by night, any person jointly concerned in such trespass or breaking commits or attempts to commit murder or voluntarily causes or attempts to cause grievous hurt to any person, every person so concerned in such trespass or breaking shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonestly breaking open receptacle containing property.
short_description: Dishonestly breaking open a receptacle containing property.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever dishonestly or with intent to commit mischief, breaks open or unfastens any closed receptacle which contains or is reputed to contain any property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Theft after preparation for causing death, hurt or restraint.
short_description: Theft after preparation to cause death, hurt or restraint in order to the committing of the theft.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits theft, having made preparation for causing death, or hurt, or wrongful restraint, or fear of death, or of hurt, or of wrongful restraint, to any person, in order to the committing of such theft, or in order to the effecting of his escape after the committing of such theft, or in order to the retaining of property taken by such theft, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for forgery.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of forgery.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits forgery shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Forgery of record of Court or of public register, etc.
short_description: Forgery of court records, public registers, or other official documents.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever forges a document, purporting to be a record or proceeding of or in a Court of Justice, or a register of birth, death or marriage, or any other public register, or any entry in any such register, or any certificate or document purporting to be made by a public servant in his official capacity, or any authority of such public servant, or any authority of such public servant, or any authority of such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
short_description: Forgery of valuable security, a will, or authority to adopt a son.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever forges a document which is, or purports to be, a valuable security, or a will, or an authority to adopt a son, or which purports to give authority to any person to make a valuable security, or to make a will, or to adopt a son, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery for purpose of cheating.
short_description: Forging a document with the intent to cheat.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document forged shall be used for the purpose of cheating, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery for purpose of harming reputation.
short_description: Forging a document to harm someone's reputation.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document forged shall harm the reputation of any person, or knowing it to be likely that it will be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using as genuine a forged document or electronic record.
short_description: Using a forged document as if it were genuine.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any document or electronic record which he knows or has reason to believe to be a forged document or forged electronic record, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had forged such document or electronic record.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery punishable under section 467.
short_description: Making or possessing a counterfeit seal with intent to commit forgery of valuable security.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes or counterfeits any seal, plate or instrument for the purpose of committing any forgery which shall be punishable under section 467, or being in possession of any such seal, plate or instrument, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery punishable otherwise.
short_description: Making or possessing a counterfeit seal to commit forgery punishable under other sections.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes or counterfeits any seal, plate or instrument for the purpose of committing any forgery which shall be punishable otherwise than under section 467, or being in possession of any such seal, plate or instrument, knowing the same to be counterfeit, and intending to use it for the purpose of committing any forgery, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Having possession of document described in section 466 or 467, knowing it to be forged and intending to use it as genuine.
short_description: Having possession of a forged document with intent to use it as genuine.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine. If the forged document is of the kind mentioned in section 467, imprisonment for life or up to 7 years.
court_jurisdiction: Magistrate of the First Class, Court of Session
full_legal_text: Whoever has in his possession any document which he knows or has reason to believe to be a forged document, and intending that it shall be fraudulently or dishonestly used as genuine, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents described in section 467, or possessing counterfeit marked material.
short_description: Counterfeiting a seal or mark used to authenticate valuable securities or wills.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever counterfeits any device or mark used for authenticating documents described in section 467, or has in his possession any counterfeit material so marked, with the intention of using it for the purpose of committing forgery, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents other than those described in section 467, or possessing counterfeit marked material.
short_description: Counterfeiting a seal or mark to authenticate other documents.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever counterfeits any device or mark used for authenticating documents other than those described in section 467, or has in his possession any counterfeit material so marked, with the intention of using it for the purpose of committing forgery, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulent cancellation, destruction, etc., of will, authority to adopt, or valuable security.
short_description: Fraudulently destroying a will, valuable security, or authority to adopt.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly, or with intent to cause wrongful loss to any person, or with intent to conceal the commission of an offence, cancels, destroys, or defaces a will, or any valuable security, or any document which is or purports to be an authority to adopt a son, or a valuable security, or any part thereof, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Falsification of accounts.
short_description: Falsifying accounts with intent to defraud.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a clerk, officer or servant, or being employed or acting in the capacity of a clerk, officer or servant, wilfully, and with intent to defraud, destroys, alters, mutilates, or falsifies any book, paper, writing, valuable security or account which belongs to or is in the possession of his employer, or has been received by him for his employer, or wilfully, and with intent to defraud, makes or abets the making of any false entry in, or omits or alters or abets the omission or alteration of any entry in, any such book, paper, writing, valuable security or account, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for using a false property mark.
short_description: Punishment for using a false property mark.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever uses any false property mark shall, unless he proves that he acted without intent to defraud, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting a property mark.
short_description: Counterfeiting a property mark.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever counterfeits any property mark used by any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting a mark used by a public servant.
short_description: Counterfeiting a mark used by a public servant.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever counterfeits any mark used by a public servant for the purpose of authenticating any goods or documents, or of testifying to the correctness of any measure, or of any other matter, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit plate, etc., with intent to counterfeit trade mark or property mark.
short_description: Making or possessing a counterfeit plate with intent to counterfeit a mark.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes or has in his possession any die, plate, or other instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark, or for the purpose of counterfeiting a device or mark used for authenticating documents, or for the purpose of forging a document, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Selling goods marked with a counterfeit property mark.
short_description: Selling goods with a counterfeit property mark.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells, or exposes for sale, or has in his possession for sale, any goods or things with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Making a false mark on any receptacle containing goods.
short_description: Making a false mark on a receptacle containing goods.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes any false mark on any receptacle containing goods, with the intent that such goods shall be fraudulently passed off as the goods of another person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for selling goods marked with a counterfeit property mark.
short_description: Punishment for selling goods with a counterfeit property mark.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells, or exposes for sale, or has in his possession for sale, any goods or things with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Tampering with property mark with intent to cause injury.
short_description: Tampering with a property mark with intent to cause injury.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, with intent to cause injury to any person, or with intent to defraud, tampers with any property mark, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting currency notes or bank notes.
short_description: Counterfeiting currency notes or bank notes.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever counterfeits, or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting, any currency note or bank note, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using as genuine, forged or counterfeit currency notes or bank notes.
short_description: Using a forged or counterfeit currency note as genuine.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells, purchases, or receives from any other person, or otherwise deals in or disposes of, or brings into India, any forged or counterfeit currency note or bank note, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be forged or counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of forged or counterfeit currency notes or bank notes.
short_description: Possessing forged or counterfeit currency notes.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever has in his possession any forged or counterfeit currency note or bank note, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be forged or counterfeit and intending to use the same as genuine or that it may be used as genuine, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Making or possessing instruments or materials for forging or counterfeiting currency notes or bank notes.
short_description: Making or possessing tools for counterfeiting currency notes.
punishment: Imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes or has in his possession any die, plate, or other instrument or material for the purpose of forging or counterfeiting any currency note or bank note, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or using a mark used for authenticating currency notes or bank notes.
short_description: Making or using a mark used for authenticating currency notes.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes or counterfeits any mark used for authenticating currency notes or bank notes, or has in his possession any counterfeit material so marked, with the intention of using it for the purpose of committing forgery, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal breach of contract of service during voyage or journey.
short_description: Criminal breach of a contract of service during a voyage or journey.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to 100 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being bound by a contract in writing to attend on and serve any person during a voyage or journey, or to assist in the navigation or working of any ship or vessel, or to serve on any railway, and being in a state of health to be capable of attending on or serving, or to assist in the navigation or working of the same, voluntarily abstains from so doing, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Breach of contract to attend on and supply wants of helpless person.
short_description: Breach of a contract to attend to a helpless person.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to 200 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being bound by a contract to attend on and supply the wants of any person who, by reason of his youth, or of unsoundness of mind, or of a disease, is helpless and unable to provide for himself, voluntarily abstains from so doing, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Breach of contract of service during voyage or journey.
short_description: Breach of contract of service during a voyage or journey, by a seaman or mariner.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to 100 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being bound by a contract in writing to attend on and serve any person during a voyage or journey, or to assist in the navigation or working of any ship or vessel, and being in a state of health to be capable of attending on or serving, or to assist in the navigation or working of the same, voluntarily abstains from so doing, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Cohabitation caused by a man deceitfully inducing a belief of lawful marriage.
short_description: A man deceitfully inducing a woman to cohabit with him, believing they are lawfully married.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, being a man, by deceit causes any woman who is not lawfully married to him to believe that she is lawfully married to him and to cohabit with him in that belief, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife.
short_description: Marrying again while a husband or wife is living, if the marriage is void.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, having a husband or wife living, marries in any case in which such marriage is void by reason of its taking place during the life of such husband or wife, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Same offence with concealment of former marriage from person with whom subsequent marriage is contracted.
short_description: The same offence but with the concealment of the previous marriage.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits the offence defined in the last preceding section having concealed from the person with whom the subsequent marriage is contracted, the fact of the former marriage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage.
short_description: Fraudulently going through a marriage ceremony without a lawful marriage.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, dishonestly or with a fraudulent intention, goes through the ceremony of being married, knowing that he is not thereby lawfully married, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Adultery.
short_description: Voluntary sexual intercourse by a man with another's wife.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, or fine, or both. (This section was struck down as unconstitutional by the Supreme Court of India in Joseph Shine v. Union of India, 2018).
full_legal_text: Whoever has sexual intercourse with the wife of another man, without the consent or connivance of that man, such sexual intercourse not amounting to the offence of rape, is guilty of the offence of adultery, and shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman.
short_description: Enticing a married woman away from her husband with a criminal intent.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever takes or entices away any woman who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of another man, from that man, or from any person having the care of her on behalf of that man, with intent that she may have illicit intercourse with any person, or conceals or detains her with that intent, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for defamation.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of defamation.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever defames another shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Printing or engraving matter known to be defamatory.
short_description: Printing or engraving defamatory matter.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever prints or engraves any matter, knowing or having good reason to believe that such matter is defamatory of any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter.
short_description: Selling a substance containing defamatory matter.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever sells or offers for sale any printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter, knowing that it contains such matter, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace.
short_description: Intentionally insulting someone to provoke them to break the peace.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever intentionally insults, and thereby gives provocation to any person, intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause him to break the public peace, or to commit any other offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Statements conducing to public mischief.
short_description: Making or circulating statements that cause public mischief.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever makes, publishes or circulates any statement, rumour or report, with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, any officer, soldier, sailor or airman in the Army, Navy or Air Force to mutiny, or with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public, or to incite any class or community of persons to commit any offence against any other class or community of persons, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for criminal intimidation.
short_description: Punishment for the offence of criminal intimidation.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both. If the threat is of death, grievous hurt, etc., up to 7 years, and fine.
court_jurisdiction: Any Magistrate, Magistrate of the First Class
full_legal_text: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; and if the threat be to cause death or grievous hurt, or to set fire to any property, or to cause an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, or to cause the death of any person, or to cause a woman to be a prostitute, or to cause a person to commit suicide, the imprisonment may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication.
short_description: Criminal intimidation by an anonymous or concealed communication.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years in addition to the punishment for criminal intimidation.
full_legal_text: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication, or having taken precaution to conceal the name or abode of the person from whom the threat comes, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to the punishment provided for the offence of criminal intimidation.

title: Act caused by inducing a person to believe that he will be rendered an object of Divine displeasure.
short_description: Causing someone to do an act by threatening them with Divine displeasure.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever voluntarily causes or attempts to cause any person to do anything which he is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do anything which he is legally entitled to do, by inducing or attempting to induce that person to believe that he or any person in whom he is interested will become or will be rendered by some act of the offender an object of Divine displeasure, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman.
short_description: Using a word, gesture, or act to insult the modesty of a woman.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.
full_legal_text: Whoever, intending to insult the modesty of any woman, utters any word, makes any sound or gesture, or exhibits any object, intending that such word, sound, gesture or object shall be heard or seen by such woman, or intrudes upon the privacy of such woman, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Misconduct in public by a drunken person.
short_description: Misconduct in public by a drunken person.
punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 24 hours, or fine up to 10 rupees, or both.
full_legal_text: Whoever, in a state of intoxication, appears in any public place, or in any place which it is a trespass in him to enter, and there conducts himself in a disorderly manner, or annoys any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to twenty-four hours, or with fine which may extend to ten rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment.
short_description: Punishment for attempting to commit a crime.
punishment: Imprisonment up to half of the longest term for the offence, or with fine, or both.
court_jurisdiction: Court of Session, Magistrate of the First Class
full_legal_text: Whoever attempts to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or with imprisonment, or to cause such an offence to be committed, and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the offence, shall, where no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such attempt, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the longest term of imprisonment provided for that offence, or with fine, or with both.
